parameter.baseline_audience_influencers_id: (string) ID of the baseline audience influencers.
parameter.count: (number, optional) Number of items per page (default: 200).
parameter.bio_keyword: (string, optional) Filter influencers by bio keyword.
parameter.entity_type: (enum: person | brand, optional) Filter by entity type.
parameter.categories: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by categories.
parameter.countries: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by country ISO codes.

parameter.audience_content_id: (string) The ID of the audience content.

parameter.report_id: (string) The ID of the intelligence report to summarize.

name: Firecrawl

tools.name: firecrawl_scrape
tools.description: Scrape content from a single URL with advanced options.

parameter.url: (string) The URL to scrape
parameter.onlyMainContent: (boolean) Whether to only return the main content
parameter.waitFor: (number) Time to wait for page elements to load (in milliseconds)
parameter.timeout: (number) Maximum time to wait for the scrape to complete (in milliseconds)
parameter.mobile: (boolean) Whether to simulate a mobile device
parameter.includeTags: (array) List of tags to include in the scrape
parameter.excludeTags: (array) List of tags to exclude from the scrape

tools.name: firecrawl_batch_scrape
tools.description: Scrape multiple URLs efficiently with built-in rate limiting and parallel processing.

tools.description: Check the status of a batch operation.

parameter.id: (string) The ID of the batch operation to check

tools.name: firecrawl_search
tools.description: Search the web and optionally extract content from search results.

parameter.limit: (number) Maximum number of results to return
parameter.country: (string) Country code for the search results
parameter.scrapeOptions: (object) Additional options for scraping the search results

tools.name: firecrawl_crawl
tools.description: Start an asynchronous crawl with advanced options.

parameter.url: (string) The starting URL for the crawl
parameter.maxDepth: (number) Maximum recursive depth for the crawl
parameter.limit: (number) Maximum number of URLs to crawl

tools.name: firecrawl_extract
tools.description: Extract structured information from web pages using LLM capabilities.

parameter.urls: (array) List of URLs to extract information from
parameter.prompt: (string) Custom prompt for the LLM extraction
parameter.systemPrompt: (string) System prompt to guide the LLM
parameter.schema: (object) JSON schema for structured data extraction
parameter.enableWebSearch: (boolean) Enable web search for additional context

tools.name: firecrawl_deep_research
tools.description: Conduct deep web research on a query using intelligent crawling, search, and LLM analysis.

parameter.query: (string, required) The research question or topic to explore
parameter.maxDepth: (number, optional) Maximum recursive depth for crawling/search (default: 3)
parameter.timeLimit: (number, optional) Time limit in seconds for the research session (default: 120)
parameter.maxUrls: (number, optional) Maximum number of URLs to analyze (default: 50)

tools.name: firecrawl_generate_llmstxt
tools.description: Generate a standardized llms.txt (and optionally llms-full.txt) file for a given domain.

parameter.url: (string, required) The base URL of the website to analyze
parameter.maxUrls: (number, optional) Max number of URLs to include (default: 10)
parameter.showFullText: (boolean, optional) Whether to include llms-full.txt contents in the response

tools.name: string
tools.description: Tools to set, get strings with expiration. Useful for storing simple configuration values, session data, or caching responses.

tools.description: Tools to store field-value pairs within a single key. The hash can store vector embeddings. Useful for representing objects with multiple attributes, user profiles, or product information where fields can be accessed individually.

tools.name: list
tools.description: Tools with common operations to append and pop items. Useful for queues, message brokers, or maintaining a list of most recent actions.

tools.name: set
tools.description: Tools to add, remove and list set members. Useful for tracking unique values like user IDs or tags, and for performing set operations like intersection.

tools.name: sorted set
tools.description: Tools to manage data for e.g. leaderboards, priority queues, or time-based analytics with score-based ordering.

tools.name: pub/sub
tools.description: Functionality to publish messages to channels and subscribe to receive them. Useful for real-time notifications, chat applications, or distributing updates to multiple clients.

tools.name: streams
tools.description: Tools to add, read, and delete from data streams. Useful for event sourcing, activity feeds, or sensor data logging with consumer groups support.

tools.name: JSON
tools.description: Tools to store, retrieve, and manipulate JSON documents in Redis. Useful for complex nested data structures, document databases, or configuration management with path-based access.

name: StarRocks
description: StarRocks数据库操作,包括:执行SELECT/DDL/DML查询、生成Plotly图表、获取表和数据库概览信息

tools.name: read_query
tools.description: Execute a SELECT query or other commands that return a ResultSet (e.g., SHOW, DESCRIBE).

tools.name: write_query
tools.description: Execute a DDL (CREATE, ALTER, DROP), DML (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE), or other StarRocks command that does not return a ResultSet.

tools.name: query_and_plotly_chart
tools.description: Executes a SQL query, loads the results into a Pandas DataFrame, and generates a Plotly chart using a provided Python expression.

parameter.plotly_expr: (string) Python expression string using 'px' (Plotly Express) and 'df' (DataFrame). Example: 'px.scatter(df, x="col1", y="col2")'

tools.name: table_overview
tools.description: Get an overview of a specific table: columns (from DESCRIBE), total row count, and sample rows (LIMIT 3). Uses an in-memory cache unless refresh is true.

parameter.table: (string) Table name, optionally prefixed with database name (e.g., 'db_name.table_name' or 'table_name'). If database is omitted, uses STARROCKS_DB environment variable if set.
parameter.refresh: (Optional, boolean) Set to true to bypass the cache. Defaults to false.

tools.name: db_overview
tools.description: Get an overview (columns, row count, sample rows) for all tables within a specified database. Uses the table-level cache for each table unless refresh is true.

parameter.db: (string) Database name. Optional if STARROCKS_DB env var is set.
parameter.refresh: (Optional, boolean) Set to true to bypass the cache for all tables in the DB. Defaults to false.

tools.description: Lists all customers in Stripe.

tools.description: Creates a new coupon in Stripe.

tools.description: Lists all coupons in Stripe.

tools.description: Creates a new product in Stripe.

tools.description: Lists all prices in Stripe.

tools.description: Creates a new payment link in Stripe.

parameter.line_items: (array) An array of line items to include in the payment link.
parameter.success_url: (string) The URL to redirect to after a successful payment.
parameter.cancel_url: (string) The URL to redirect to if the payment is canceled.

tools.name: createInvoice
tools.description: Creates a new invoice in Stripe.

parameter.customer: (string) The ID of the customer to create the invoice for.
parameter.lines: (array) An array of line items to include in the invoice.

tools.name: createInvoiceItem
tools.description: Creates a new invoice item in Stripe.

parameter.customer: (string) The ID of the customer to create the invoice item for.
parameter.amount: (number) The amount of the invoice item in cents.
parameter.currency: (string) The currency of the invoice item.

tools.name: finalizeInvoice
tools.description: Finalizes an invoice in Stripe.

parameter.invoice: (string) The ID of the invoice to finalize.

tools.name: retrieveBalance
tools.description: Retrieves the current balance in Stripe.

tools.description: Lists all subscriptions in Stripe.

tools.name: updateSubscription
tools.description: Updates an existing subscription in Stripe.

parameter.subscription: (string) The ID of the subscription to update.
parameter.items: (array) An array of subscription items to update.

tools.name: cancelSubscription
tools.description: Cancels an existing subscription in Stripe.

parameter.subscription: (string) The ID of the subscription to cancel.

tools.name: createRefund
tools.description: Creates a new refund in Stripe.

parameter.charge: (string) The ID of the charge to refund.
parameter.amount: (Optional, number) The amount to refund in cents.

tools.name: listDisputes
tools.description: Lists all disputes in Stripe.

tools.name: updateDispute
tools.description: Updates an existing dispute in Stripe.

parameter.dispute: (string) The ID of the dispute to update.
parameter.evidence: (object) Evidence to submit for the dispute.

tools.name: search

parameter.similarity_threshold: (number, required) A float between 0 and 1 where 1.0 means an exact match
parameter.max_results: (number, optional) Maximum number of publications to return. Default is 10
parameter.year_from: (number, optional) Lower bound for publication year
parameter.year_to: (number, optional) Upper bound for publication year
parameter.venue_filter: (string, optional) Case-insensitive substring filter for publication venues
parameter.include_bibtex: (boolean, optional) Whether to include BibTeX entries in the results. Default is false

parameter.max_results: (number, optional) Maximum number of publications to return. Default is 20
parameter.include_bibtex: (boolean, optional) Whether to include BibTeX entries in the results. Default is false

name: National Parks
description: 1. Search for national parks based on various criteria 2. Get comprehensive information about a specific national park 3. Get current alerts for national parks including closures, hazards, and important information 4. Get information about visitor centers and their operating hours 5. Get information about available campgrounds and their amenities 6. Find upcoming events at parks

tools.name: findParks
tools.description: Search for national parks based on various criteria

parameter.stateCode: (optional string) Filter parks by state code (e.g., 'CA' for California). Multiple states can be comma-separated (e.g., 'CA,OR,WA')
parameter.q: (optional string) Search term to filter parks by name or description
parameter.limit: (optional number) Maximum number of parks to return (default: 10, max: 50)
parameter.start: (optional number) Start position for results (useful for pagination)

tools.name: getParkDetails
tools.description: Get comprehensive information about a specific national park

parameter.parkCode: (string) The park code of the national park (e.g., 'yose' for Yosemite, 'grca' for Grand Canyon)

tools.name: getAlerts
tools.description: Get current alerts for national parks including closures, hazards, and important information

parameter.parkCode: (optional string) Filter alerts by park code (e.g., 'yose' for Yosemite). Multiple parks can be comma-separated (e.g., 'yose,grca')
parameter.limit: (optional number) Maximum number of alerts to return (default: 10, max: 50)
parameter.start: (optional number) Start position for results (useful for pagination)
parameter.q: (optional string) Search term to filter alerts by title or description

tools.name: getVisitorCenters
tools.description: Get information about visitor centers and their operating hours

parameter.parkCode: (optional string) Filter visitor centers by park code (e.g., 'yose' for Yosemite). Multiple parks can be comma-separated (e.g., 'yose,grca')
parameter.limit: (optional number) Maximum number of visitor centers to return (default: 10, max: 50)
parameter.start: (optional number) Start position for results (useful for pagination)
parameter.q: (optional string) Search term to filter visitor centers by name or description

tools.name: getCampgrounds
tools.description: Get information about available campgrounds and their amenities

parameter.parkCode: (optional string) Filter campgrounds by park code (e.g., 'yose' for Yosemite). Multiple parks can be comma-separated (e.g., 'yose,grca')
parameter.limit: (optional number) Maximum number of campgrounds to return (default: 10, max: 50)
parameter.start: (optional number) Start position for results (useful for pagination)
parameter.q: (optional string) Search term to filter campgrounds by name or description

tools.name: getEvents
tools.description: Find upcoming events at parks

parameter.parkCode: (optional string) Filter events by park code (e.g., 'yose' for Yosemite). Multiple parks can be comma-separated (e.g., 'yose,grca')
parameter.limit: (optional number) Maximum number of events to return (default: 10, max: 50)
parameter.start: (optional number) Start position for results (useful for pagination)
parameter.dateStart: (optional string) Start date for filtering events (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameter.dateEnd: (optional string) End date for filtering events (format: YYYY-MM-DD)
parameter.q: (optional string) Search term to filter events by title or description

tools.name: retrieve_semantically_similar_internal_knowledge
tools.description: Retrieves semantically similar matches from the connected Rememberizer personal/team internal knowledge and memory repository.

parameter.match_this: (string) Up to a 400-word sentence for which you wish to find semantically similar chunks of knowledge
parameter.n_results: (Optional, integer) Number of semantically similar chunks of text to return. Use 'n_results=3' for up to 5, and 'n_results=10' for more information
parameter.from_datetime_ISO8601: (Optional, string) Start date in ISO 8601 format with timezone (e.g., 2023-01-01T00:00:00Z). Use this to filter results from a specific date
parameter.to_datetime_ISO8601: (Optional, string) End date in ISO 8601 format with timezone (e.g., 2024-01-01T00:00:00Z). Use this to filter results until a specific date

tools.name: smart_search_internal_knowledge
tools.description: Searches for documents in Rememberizer's personal/team internal knowledge and memory repository using a simple query. The search may include sources such as Slack discussions, Gmail, Dropbox documents, Google Drive documents, and uploaded files.

parameter.query: (string) Up to a 400-word sentence for which you wish to find semantically similar chunks of knowledge
parameter.user_context: (Optional, string) Additional context for the query. Summarize the conversation up to this point for better context-aware results
parameter.n_results: (Optional, integer) Number of semantically similar chunks of text to return. Use 'n_results=3' for up to 5, and 'n_results=10' for more information
parameter.from_datetime_ISO8601: (Optional, string) Start date in ISO 8601 format with timezone (e.g., 2023-01-01T00:00:00Z). Use this to filter results from a specific date
parameter.to_datetime_ISO8601: (Optional, string) End date in ISO 8601 format with timezone (e.g., 2024-01-01T00:00:00Z). Use this to filter results until a specific date

tools.name: list_internal_knowledge_systems

tools.description: Gets information about the Rememberizer.ai personal/team knowledge repository account, including account holder name and email address.

tools.name: list_personal_team_knowledge_documents
tools.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all documents in the personal/team knowledge system. Sources could include Slack discussions, Gmail, Dropbox documents, Google Drive documents, and uploaded files.

parameter.page: (Optional, integer) Page number for pagination, starts at 1 (default: 1)
parameter.page_size: (Optional, integer) Number of documents per page, range 1-1000 (default: 100)

parameter.content: (string) The information you wish to memorize

parameter.maxCat: (Optional, number) Maximum climb category. Requires activityType: 'riding'.

parameter.startDateLocal: (Optional, string) Filter efforts starting after this date-time (ISO 8601 format).
parameter.endDateLocal: (Optional, string) Filter efforts ending before this date-time (ISO 8601 format).
parameter.perPage: (Optional, number) Number of results per page. Default: 30

tools.name: list-athlete-routes
tools.description: Lists the routes created by the authenticated athlete.

parameter.perPage: (Optional, number) Number of routes per page. Default: 30

tools.description: Exports a specific route in TCX format and saves it locally.

parameter.routeId: (Required, number) The unique identifier of the route.

tools.name: get-activity-streams
tools.description: Retrieves detailed time-series data streams from a Strava activity.

parameter.id: (Required, number | string) The Strava activity identifier to fetch streams for.
parameter.types: (Optional, array) Types of streams to fetch. Default: ['time', 'distance', 'heartrate', 'cadence', 'watts'].
parameter.series_type: (Optional, string) Base series type for data point indexing. Default: 'distance'.
parameter.page: (Optional, number) Page number for paginated results. Default: 1.
parameter.points_per_page: (Optional, number) Number of data points per page. Default: 100. Special value: -1 returns ALL data points split into multiple messages.

tools.name: get-activity-laps
tools.description: Retrieves the laps recorded for a specific Strava activity.

parameter.id: (Required, number | string) The unique identifier of the Strava activity.
